answers.answer: I know it's hard but try not to worry about the birth-all you have to remember is what you will get at the end of it.I'm not going to lie birth is unbelievably painful-I went natural but remember there are so many meds out there you can have. With regards to stitches it depends on so many things but generally if you do exactly what your midwife tells you, you will be fine.Think how many women go through birth every day & think how many of those go on to have more children!!Please lovely just enjoy your pregnancy-& think about how great you're going to feel with your beautiful baby in your arms.I'm here if you ever want to chatFreya xx

Hi thereEvery birth is different but the majority of people will not need stitches unless there is a medical emergency and a cesarian is neccesary or the baby has to be forcefully removed vaginally.I had three births and I had epidural for the pain and it was fine. The contractions are quite painful as they get stronger but the gas and air really takes the edge off it .  They do the epidural about half an hour before the birth when they have checked how far dilated your womb is. (10cm I think)I only had stitches with the first baby but that was because he was getting stressed and had pooed inside me which is dangerous incase it goes into his lungs.  They used a vontuse suction thing and basically pulled him out (a doctor was called to do it)  I had several small tears and quite a few stitches and had to sit on a pillow for a week from the swelling but this was preferable to a cesarean operation which I narrowly avoided.  The internal stiches are the most uncomfortable but they only last a couple of weeks .It is unlikely you will need any stitches unless there is an emergency during the birth try to keep relaxed as if you are stressed the baby will be too.

Once I started pushing my labor was uncomplicated. She did get stuck for a few minutes, but I was able to continue. I had 16 stitches and had a 2nd degree tear and still required an episiotomy to give birth.

Wow, my experience wasn't that bad.  My labor just felt like it was hard to breath and I couldn't move during the time.  After a day of this pain getting progressively worse I went to the hospital, they monitored me for an hour and then told me that I was far enough along they would admit me.  They gave me my epidural right thenn and there and told me to get some sleep because in 5 hours I would start pushing. I then tried to sleep but didn't, and didn't feel any pain just a little uncomfortable.  I pushed for three hours and should have only pushed for 15 minutes but I was scared so don't be scared just push with all your might and it will be over faster.  I think I might of gotten stiches but I didn't ask because frankly I didn't want to know.  Just go in with the attitude that you can do it, and you will be fine.  Frankly you don't care about stiches, pain or anything about you after you see your baby for the first time.  I fell in love and I am so looking forward to it again in a little over 7 weeks!

I had a bad labor, but I won't get into details about it. I had back labor really badly as well as hyperemesis, preeclampsia, and SPD. I pushed so hard that I gave myself hemorrhoids because she was stuck and I was determined not to have a cesarean.Also, after you have your baby, your focus isn't really on yourself or how badly you hurt. At least mine wasn't anyways.
